quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Novel and Man
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, criminals, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In this novel, an adult man is obsessed with a teenage girl.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lolita

questions.question: In this book, a man says that he will stop the motor of the world. He does so by removing the creative and visionary leaders from society one by one, tempting them to come live in an utopian society in the wilderness.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlas Shrugged

questions.question: A man who searches for inner peace, finally finding it by the side of a river is the protagonist of this 1922 German novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Siddhartha

questions.question: They hand in hand, with wandering steps  and slow,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Milton

questions.question: Name the movie that ends with the following line: Louis. I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Casablanca

questions.question: In this book, a man loses his memory during the war, falls in love and marries, then hits his head and remembers his former life, forgetting his wife completely.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Random Harvest

questions.question: In this novel, the son of a wealthy man is obsessed with creating more wealth, in a subconscious desire to rebel against his father. In the end, he discovers that he has become his father. During his life, he invests in airplanes and movies, among other things. He has many affairs with beautiful women along the way.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Carpetbaggers

questions.question: This novel tells the story of a man that meets his double and changes identities with him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Scapegoat

questions.question: A mild-mannered coward is enlisted to help a group of hardened criminals pull off a museum theft in this 1962 English novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Light of Day

questions.question: This book tells the story of a pilot and a scientist on an air expedition to Greenland who have separate dreams of being two long-dead lovers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An Old Captivity

questions.question: The main character of this novel can make people disappear from existence with an effort of will.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stranger in a Strange Land

questions.question: Electrodes are implanted into the brain of this book’s protagonist in an effort to cure his seizures. But the electrodes fire too often, making him go on a murderous rampage.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Terminal Man

questions.question: So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back into the past. was  the last line in a book by this  author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: F. Scott Fitzgerald

questions.question: Which movie ends with these lines:  Yes! Yes! I believe it. I believe it because I want  to believe it. Gentlemen I give you a toast. Heres my hope that Robert Conway will find his Shangri-La. Heres my hope that we all find our Shangri-La.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lost Horizon

questions.question: Who wrote the semi-autobiographical novel Junkie, which gives an account of the lifestyle of heroin addicts in the early 1950s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William S. Burroughs

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Movie and Line
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, amanda, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which novel by Charles Dickens is generally regarded as the first Victorian novel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pickwick Papers

questions.question: Which great movie ends with these lines: O-Lan, you are the Earth.?

options.text: The Day the Earth Stood Still

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Good Earth

questions.question: This movie is about a drifter, who works for a cruel boss at a textile mill, and comes across a mutated rat with no eyes or legs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Graveyard Shift

questions.question: Which great movie ends with this line: The, uh, stuff that dreams are made of. Huh?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Maltese Falcon

questions.question: Which movie ends with these lines: Hello everybody. This is Mrs. Norman Maine.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Star is Born

questions.question: What actress plays Annie Wilkes in the movie Misery?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kathy Bates

questions.question: This Stephen King movie is about Jack Torrance, a writer who takes a job as a caretaker for the Overlook Hotel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Shining

questions.question: Which novel by Thomas Hardy had the subtitle A Pure Woman, which shocked Victorian readers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tess of the dUrbervilles

questions.question: This actress played the little girl, Amanda, in the horror movie Cats Eye.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drew Barrymore

questions.question: Mother of Mercy! Is this the end of Rico? is the  last line of this great movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Ceasar

questions.question: Which great movie ends with this line: Victory is Ours!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Duck Soup

questions.question: Which of the Bronte sisters wrote Shirley, a novel set in Yorkshire during the industrial depression?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlotte

questions.question: This highly symbolic story by Polish-born novelist Joseph Conrad served as a base for the movie Apocalypse Now.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heart of Darkness

questions.question: Which Shakespearean play ends with this line: So thanks to all at once and  to each one, Whom we invite to see us crowned at Scone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Macbeth

questions.question: What animal was the main character in the horror movie Cujo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dog

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Novel and Characters
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, widow, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The characters in this novel included Pierre Bezukov, Natasha Rostovic, Sonya Rostovic, Andrei N. Bolkov and Elene Kuragin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: War and Peace

questions.question: Jim, Widow Douglas, Miss Watson, The Grangerford and the Shepardsons were characters in this novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn

questions.question: Ahab, Ishmael, Starbuck, Stubb, Queequeg and Elijah were characters in this 1851 novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moby Dick

questions.question: This literary work by Mary Shelley, infused with some elements of the Gothic novel, was subtitled The Modern Prometheus.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frankenstein

questions.question: Which list contains the names of the Bennet sisters, depicted by Jane Austin in Pride and Prejudice?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elisabeth, Jane, Lydia, Kitty, Mary

questions.question: Which of these books were written by Victorian novelist Mary Anne Evans, commonly known as George Eliot?

options.text: The Mill on the Floss, Adam Bede, A Room of Ones Own
Middlemarch, The Mill on the Floss, Adam Bede
The Mill on the Floss, Vanity Fair, Adam Bede
Middlemarch, North and South, Vanity Fair

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Middlemarch, The Mill on the Floss, Adam Bede

questions.question: Elizabeth Bennet, Mr. Darcy, Mr. Bennett, Charles Bingley and William Collins were characters in this novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pride and  Prejudice

questions.question: Which of these literary works was written in the form of a long letter while the author was in prison?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: De Profundis

questions.question: The characters in this novel included Wilfred, Rebecca, Rowena, Isaac of York and Prior.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ivanhoe

questions.question: The characters in this novel included Charles Marlow, Kurtz, Fresleven, Chief Accountant and General Manager.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Heart of Darkness

questions.question: Jim, Marlowe, Stein, Sherif Ali, Rajah Tunka Allang and Gentleman Brown were characters in this novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lord Jim

questions.question: What are the two cities named in the title of Charles Dickens historical novel A Tale of Two Cities?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paris and London

questions.question: The characters in this novel included Hester Prynne, Pearl, Roger Chillingworth and Arthur Dimmsdale.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Scarlet Letter

questions.question: This novel, which satirizes society in early 19th-century England, opens at Miss Pinkertons Academy for Young Ladies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vanity Fair

questions.question: Raskolnikov, Sonya S. and Porfry were characters in this novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crime and Punishment

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Jurassic Park and Book
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, donald, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This dinosaur, depicted in the novel Jurassic Park, was a very beautiful carnivore but spat poison to blind its prey.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dilophosaur

questions.question: In the film Gone with the Wind, Scarletts first husband died in the early days of the Civil War. What was the cause of his death?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Measles and pneumonia

questions.question: In the movie Gone With the Wind Scarlett had three husbands. Who was the first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Hamilton

questions.question: Ian Malcolm, a character from the book Jurassic Park, is an expert in which field?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chaos Theory

questions.question: Dennis Nedry was paid by a rival company to sabotage Jurassic Park in the self-titled book.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The dinosaurs, featured in Michael Crichtons novel Jurassic Park, were supposedly not able to breed inside the park for what reason?

options.text: They were all neutered at birth
They were fed a special drug to keep them from breeding

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were all female

questions.question: What was the occupation of Donald Gennaro, the character in the book Jurassic Park who originally tried to get Jurassic Park shut down?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lawyer

questions.question: Why was a diagonal red line painted on the jeeps in the book Jurassic Park?

options.text: The triceratops didnt like the red line, therefore they wouldnt charge the jeeps.
It was the symbol of Jurassic Park Theme Park.
The velociraptors regarded red as a color that signified some larger predator.
The apatosaurs thought that stripes were an indication of a predator so they stayed away.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The triceratops didnt like the red line, therefore they wouldnt charge the jeeps.

questions.question: The Institute of Vertebrate Paleontology and Paleoanthropology of the Chinese Academy of Sciences named the new ankylosaurus species Crichtonsaurus in honor of Michael Crichton, the author of Jurassic Park.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The game warden, Muldoon, was killed by raptors in the book Jurassic Park.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The characters in this novel included Becky Sharp, Amelia Smedley, George Osborne and Pitt Crawley.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vanity Fair

questions.question: In the film Gone with the Wind, when Rhett and Scarlett came back from their honeymoon they brought a gift for Mammy. What was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red silk petticoat

questions.question: Clara, Mr. Chiilg, Mr. Creadle, Peggotty and Betsy Trotwood were characters in this novel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Copperfield

questions.question: In the novel Jurassic Park,  the zoo-like amusement park is on an island, situated off the shore of what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Costa Rica

questions.question: How many T-Rexes were there in the novel Jurassic Park?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Wind and Scarlett Ohara
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, actor, summer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the Atlanta street where fictional character Scarlett OHara lived with Aunt Pittypat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peachtree

questions.question: The Oscar for Best Actress in a Supporting Role went to which cast member of Gone With the Wind?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hattie McDaniel

questions.question: How many actresses auditioned for the coveted role of Scarlett OHara?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1400

questions.question: Which of the following caused the death of Scarlett and Rhetts daughter?

options.text: She mysteriously died in her crib.
She broke her neck while jumping her pony.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She broke her neck while jumping her pony.

questions.question: Vivian Leigh won the Best Actress Oscar for her performance as Scarlett OHara in Gone With the Wind. This was her only Academy Award.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Scarlett OHara wasted much of her life pining after Ashley Wilkes who was played by this actor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leslie Howard

questions.question: Vivian Leigh earned the same amount of money as Clark Gable for her work in Gone With the Wind.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Clark Gable won the Oscar for Best Actor for his role as Rhett Butler.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: And Richard Cory, one calm summer night,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edwin Arlington Robinson

questions.question: There is only one scene in the movie Gone with the Wind that suggests Scarlett has a problem with alcohol consumption.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Where did Gone with the Wind character Rhett get the inspiration for his and Scarletts daughters name from?

options.text: A nursery rhyme his mother had sung to him as a child

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The confederate flag

questions.question: What actress portrayed the character in Gone with the Wind who claimed she knew everythin bout birthin babies when, in reality, she knew nothin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Butterfly McQueen

questions.question: Which of the following lines from the movie Gone with the Wind was voted as the #1 movie quote by the American Film Institute?

options.text: After all, tomorrow is another day!
I dont know nothin bout birthin no babies!
As God is my witness, Ill never be hungry again!
Frankly my dear, I dont give a damn.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frankly my dear, I dont give a damn.

questions.question: What was NOT true of Scarletts second husband in Gone with the Wind?

options.text: The physical affliction he returned from the war with was body lice.
He died on a mission to avenge Scarletts attack in Shantytown.
He divorced Scarlett to marry her sister, Sue-Ellen.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He divorced Scarlett to marry her sister, Sue-Ellen.

questions.question: The play is the tragedy Man, and the hero, the Conquerer Worm.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edgar Allan Poe

questions.question: I saw a man pursuing the horizon;

questions.question: I have gone out, a possessed witch,

options.text: woman like that is not a woman, quite.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anne Sexton

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Golding

questions.question: Which of these novels is not part of the Forsyte Saga, written by English novelist John Galsworthy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Money

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia Woolf

questions.question: Which allegorical novel by William Golding features a group of boys stranded on a desert island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lord of the Flies

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Randall Jarrell

questions.question: A heap of broken images, where the Sun beats...
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: T.S. Eliot

questions.question: Pity this busy monster mankind not...

options.text: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young man

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulysses

questions.question: In 1989, the author of this book and all those involved in its publication were sentenced to death by the Supreme Leader of Iran.

options.text: The Gate at the End of the World

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Satanic Verses

questions.question: What do George Bernard Shaw, William Butler Yeats, Rudyard Kipling and William Golding have in common?

options.text: They were all born in Ireland.
They were members of The Fabian Society - a British socialist intellectual movement.
All of them served in WWI.
All of them received the Nobel Prize in Literature.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of them received the Nobel Prize in Literature.

questions.question: Success is counted sweetest
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Emily Dickinson

questions.question: I was ten when they buried you.

options.text: d get back, back, back to you.
t they pulled me out of the sack,
d they stuck me together with glue.
d then I knew what to do.
man in black with a Meinkampf look
